thread.title: Millburn High School varsity boys cross country team wins division individual, team crowns
thread.title_full: Millburn High School varsity boys cross country team wins division individual, team crowns

title: Millburn High School varsity boys cross country team wins division individual, team crowns
text:
Millburn High School varsity boys cross country team wins division individual, team crowns October 8, 2015 Last updated: Thursday, October 8, 2015, 12:32 AM By Jim Connelly Buy this photo photo courtesy of millburn high school boys cross country Millburn High School’s Matt Grossman cruises through Newark’s Branch Brook Park Oct. 6 on his way to winning the Super Essex Conference, American Division championship race title in record-setting fashion. 
The Milllburn High School junior won the race in 15:41.90, shattering the existing meet record of 15:45.60 set by Livingston High School’s Jeremy Elkaim in 2010, to help the Millers claim a fifth consecutive meet crown. Buy this photo photo courtesy of millburn high school boys cross country Owen McCarthy (third from left) holds the championship plaque and Ethan Thomas holds the dual meet plaque Oct. 6 after the Millers’ victory in the division title race. From left are head coach Jeff Kaye, Matt Grossman, Ramsey Little, McCarthy, Thomas, John Lacy, Chris Stone and Will Meyer. 
"It feels really amazing to win the championship and break the record," Grossman said. "Breaking a course record anywhere is a great accomplishment, but I was especially happy to break it at Branch Brook because we’ve had so many races there over the years, and it was a pretty tough record to beat. 
"Going into the race my first goal was to try to win in whatever time was necessary. But when the race went out very fast for the first mile (4:50) I decided to go for the record. I think not racing (in the) Shore Coaches (meet on Oct. 3) definitely helped my legs to feel fresher but taking the SATs was major reason for my decision not to run there." 
Three of Grossman’s teammates - Will Meyer, Chris Stone and Ramsey Little - also placed in the top 10 to earn medals. 
Meyer, a senior, placed fourth in 16:42.2. Stone, a senior, came in sixth in 16:45.7. 
Little, a freshman, finished seventh in 16:49.9. 
Seniors Ethan Thomas and Owen McCarthy also contributed to Millburn’s team score. 
Thomas finished 17th in the 69-runner field in 17:14.1 McCarthy took 19th place in 17:16.2. 
"On the team side we also had an excellent race," said Grossman, who extended the Millers’ streak of conference title race individual victories to five years. 
"Getting to repeat as conference champions in both the varsity and JV races again is a great feeling. It’s a real testament to how deep our team is this year. Specifically Ramsey Little, who’s a freshman, had a great race with a big PR. As a team we’re really looking forward to trying to win more races later in the season." 
Millburn took the team title with 34 points. 
Columbia High School (73 points) came in second followed by West Orange High School (104 points), Seton Hall Preparatory School (111 points) and Montclair Kimberley Academy (117 points). 
Visit www.essexcountytrack.bizland.com to view complete meet results.
